case_name: Lyman v. Capital City Transit District

analysis_rationale.composure_reasoning: 7 stress-indicating behavioral tags detected (throat_clear=2, pause=4, sigh=3, long pause=3, nervous laugh=1, nervous=1). Witness showed visible agitation under pressure. Aggression context: Medium.
analysis_rationale.tactical_discipline_reasoning: Average witness response: 9 words. 0 responses exceeded 30 words (over-explaining). 6 concise responses (<=5 words). Witness showed adequate restraint.
analysis_rationale.professionalism_reasoning: 0 inappropriate vocal reactions (laugh/scoff). 0 sarcastic or dismissive phrases detected. Witness maintained professional demeanor.
analysis_rationale.directness_reasoning: 'I don't recall' used 0 time(s). 0 hedging phrases (I think, maybe, perhaps). Witness was reasonably direct in responses.
analysis_rationale.consistency_reasoning: 0 contradiction/inconsistency signals detected in witness testimony. Pause frequency increased during later questioning — possible fatigue or anxiety.

critical_vulnerability.witness_reaction: Witness displayed 7 stress indicators when confronted with evidence
critical_vulnerability.trial_risk: Jury will perceive witness as unreliable and hiding information when visibly nervous under routine questioning

coaching_directive: Practice controlled breathing before answering — inhale for 3 counts after each question to eliminate reactive stress signals.
